question_sentence: Which car company announced a *shocking* name change to affirm a commitment to electric vehicles and then said it was all an April Fools’ prank?
A shooting in Southern California Wednesday night claimed the lives of four people. Where did the shooting take place?
The Ever Given ship was finally freed from the Suez Canal after blocking one-tenth of the world’s trade. How long was it stuck?
This week, New York became the 15th state to legalize recreational marijuana. True or False?
Goop queen Gwyneth Paltrow’s wellness practices always make the news. Which one of her beauty routines is getting flak from health experts?
The WHO released a report on the origins of COVID-19 this week. What was the conclusion they drew?
choices: COVID-19 was leaked from a lab.
COVID-19 likely passed from bats to humans.
COVID-19 was a mutation of the common cold.

question_sentence: No stranger to scandal, Republican Rep. Matt Gaetz is under fire after allegations he had sex with a 17-year-old. What state does he represent?
President Biden introduced a infrastructure plan this week that targets everything from  aging bridges to gun violence. How much would it cost?
Derek Chauvin’s murder trial for the death of George Floyd is underway this week. How long is the trial expected to last?
Which vaccine manufacturer halted future production of vaccines in the U.S. after a manufacturing mix-up ruined 15 million doses?
The prime minister of which country has resigned after sparking anger by agreeing a deal to buy Russia’s Sputnik V vaccine?
What is the name of Alex Salmond’s new pro-Scottish independence political party?
Which country is on the verge of developing Latin America’s first home-grown Covid vaccines?
Rupert Murdoch’s News Corp has bought the books division of Lord of the Rings publisher Houghton Mifflin Harcourt in a deal worth how much?
The German government this week suspended the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine among which demographic amid unproven safety concerns?
US-brokered talks to secure a power-sharing deal between the Afghan government and the Taliban are due to take place this month in which country?
How much did Downing Street’s new White House-style press room cost?
Which Manchester City footballer this week announced his departure from the club at the end of the season?
What is the name of the independent panel behind the newly published government-commissioned report into racism in the UK?
choices: Commission on Race and Ethnic Disparities

question_sentence: On what date will the UK go to the polls for the next local elections?
The massive container ship left stranded and blocking the Suez Canal was finally floated and cleared from the waterway. What’s the now-infamous ship’s name?
evidence: The container ship is called Ever Given, and was finally able to float away after nearly a week of round-the-clock work to dislodge the vessel from the critical waterway.

question_sentence: Which country’s leader had to replace six high-ranking ministers following their resignation, all as new variants of the coronavirus continue to wreak havoc on the country?
evidence: Brazilian leader Jair Bolsonaro made the changes, including replacement of his defense minister. Many see this as an effort designed to consolidate even more power, all while his country is crushed by new coronavirus outbreaks.

question_sentence: A high-profile, televised court case started this week for the murder of George Floyd, a Black man whose death in police custody was caught on video last year. Which former police officer is currently on trial?
evidence: All four of the above former police officers are facing criminal charges for the incident, but it’s Derek Chauvin, a White man, that’s currently standing trial for Floyd’s death. Chauvin knelt on Floyd’s neck for over nine minutes, a situation that sparked global outrage against systematic racism and brutality in policing.

question_sentence: As some US state legislatures continue to push and pass partisan legislation meant to restrict voting, which of the following states actually just passed a bipartisan bill to expand voter access?
evidence: Receiving broad, bipartisan support, Kentucky’s Republican-led General Assembly passed a bill to expand early and absentee voting. Michigan, Georgia and Arizona are among states looking to restrict similar initiatives.

question_sentence: Which Covid-19 vaccine manufacturer claims its vaccine is 100% effective on children ages 12-15 years old following clinical trials?
evidence: Pfizer made the claim about its vaccine, soon to submit its data to the FDA for Emergency Use Authorization on the age group. Currently, Covid-19 vaccines are only authorized for use on those 16 and older.

question_sentence: The United Arab Emirates recently became the first Arab nation to successfully put a spacecraft into orbit around Mars. What’s its next big space venture, currently planned to launch in 2024?
choices: a craft to orbit an asteroid
evidence: The UAE is currently planning the launch and landing of a moon rover. If successful, it will follow the US, Russia and China as the only countries to land a spacecraft on the lunar surface.

question_sentence: Tensions are rising as US intelligence observes increased troop movement in Crimea and surrounding areas. The territory is a hotbed of conflict for Russia and which other country?
evidence: Russia and Ukraine are at loggerheads over Crimea, a peninsula on the Black Sea. The two countries have been in a constant state of tension since the Russia’s annexation of the territory in 2014, and their military involvement in Ukraine’s eastern region.

question_sentence: Starting May 1, passengers on this US airline can say goodbye to the company’s policy of blocking middle seats, a safety measures established as a coronavirus safety measure.
evidence: Citing increased demand and traveler confidence, Delta is undoing its blocked middle seat policy on May 1. The company was the last airline to sustain such a practice in an effort to enhance Covid safety.

question_sentence: A Mafia fugitive was found in the Dominican Republic, now in custody in Italy. What tipped investigators off to his whereabouts?
choices: a giant yacht party breaking Covid protocols
a drug deal in broad daylight
evidence: In coordination with Interpol, Italian authorities found Marc Feren Claude Biart, suspected of involvement with the ‘Ndrangheta mafia organization, after he posted a YouTube video of himself cooking. Though his face was never shown, his tattoos were what tipped off the investigators.

question_sentence: Basketball superstar LeBron James will soon become part-owner of which professional sports team?
evidence: LeBron James, along with a few other business partners, will become part of the ownership group of the Fenway Sports Group, an organization that collectively owns the Boston Red Sox baseball team.
